title: Easy 5-Ingredient Salmon Recipe
description: This easy salmon recipe delivers big flavor with just a few pantry and fridge staples. Pan-searing in butter browns the fillets but keeps them moist.

Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 tablespoon garlic powder 1 tablespoon dried basil ½ teaspoon salt 4 (6 ounce) fillets salmon 2 tablespoons butter 4 lemon wedges Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir garlic powder, basil, and salt together in a small bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Rub the mixture evenly over salmon. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add salmon and cook until browned and flaky, about 5 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve salmon with lemon wedges. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,645 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy 5-Ingredient Salmon 01 of 166 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 166 Photo by  Liz_A 01/13/2025 My grocer pre-seasoned with lemon pepper. I added parmesan cheese and a little paprika to the rub. I sautéed with lime juice along with the butter. Excellent! 03 of 166 Photo by  Jules 08/30/2024 Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser A keeper! Very good. I used the ingredients as stated. Was concerned about adding the salt due to warnings, however the taste was perfect. I cut the salmon into 3 pieces, and I only cooked them for 4 minutes each side. The thinner pieces came out just right, the fattest piece wasn't quite done. Obviously time needs to be adjusted based on how thick your piece is. The butter gave it a nice crust. Keeping this recipe for sure. 04 of 166 Photo by  Jo-Ann 08/18/2023 05 of 166 Photo by  Natasha Titanov 03/09/2022 06 of 166 Photo by  Michael B 11/09/2021 07 of 166 Photo by  Venita Snyder 08/28/2021 This was very simple and still satisfying. I did not have any basil on hand and used a substitute Herbes de Provence. Served with fresh sautéed spinach. 08 of 166 Photo by  Gwen Oelschlgel 07/14/2021 Wow..we loved this..would make again..and again..
